page.title: 05HUTTON HENRY
page.content: Our village is a very old village, which goes back to the 9th century when it was called Hotun. In old English hoh-tun meant a hill spur settlement.For a time the village belonged to Henry-de-Esh and so it became Hutton Henry.Walhouse and the Old Hall are two of the oldest houses in the village, but like all the old houses are now modernised.On the village green there is the old water pump which is kept in good working order by Mr.A.Johnson.This year everyone in our school put their names and addresses on a piece of paper which is now in a container in the pump casing.Another interesting place is Bushy Lane (sometimes called Hangman's Lane)where a hanging is supposed to have taken place. Records show a man was executed in this village in 1569.
